mcframework.stats_engine.StatsEngine#

class mcframework.stats_engine.StatsEngine(metrics)[source]#

Bases: object

Small orchestrator that computes a dictionary of metrics over an array.

Parameters:
metricsiterable of Metric

Callables with a name attribute and signature m(x, ctx).

Parameters:

metrics (Iterable[Metric])

Examples

>>> eng = StatsEngine([FnMetric("mean", mean), FnMetric("std", std)])
>>> eng.compute(np.array([1, 2, 3]), n=3)
{'mean': 2.0, 'std': 1.0}
__init__(metrics)[source]#
Parameters:

metrics (Iterable[Metric])

Methods

__init__(metrics)

compute(x, **ctx)

Evaluate all registered metrics on x.
compute(x, **ctx)[source]#

Evaluate all registered metrics on x.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Parameters:
xndarray

Sample values.

**ctx

Extra keyword arguments forwarded to each metric.

Returns:
dict

Mapping from metric name to computed value.

Parameters:

x (ndarray)

Notes

The same context is passed to every metric. Choose distinct names if you add custom metric-specific parameters.
